children.value: The template behaves like normal markdown text. However, there are some advanced functions. For more information see

exclude:
  - Table of Contents
from-heading: 2
to-heading: 6
The table of contents can be controlled via a
– what title should not appear in the table of contents

```toc
exclude:
  - Table of Contents
from-heading: 2
to-heading: 6
```
Text · Normal text can be written as normal Markdown.

* Item A
* Item B
* Item C

const hello = "hello";
const world = "world";

console.log(`${hello} ${world}!`)

1. Item 1
2. Item 2
3. Item 3
Code can be entered either as block or inline.

Inline `code`

```js
var kk = "kk";
```
var kk = "kk";
Text with footnotes can either be made with references, as usual in Markdown:

_«Quote A»_[^quote-one]

[^quote-one]: ...
_«Quote B»_[^hier der Text]
If you want to maintain the illustrations (or other directories) outside the footnotes, you can mark the footnotes with a group prefix (

_Bild A_[^:fig:one]

[^:fig:one]: ...
_Fig. B_[^:fig:hier der Text]
Paragraphs with quotations can be specially marked.
> Text here.[^quote-one]
If there is an empathized text (
) directly below an image, this text is given the formatting for captions.

![Cat](./img/header.jpg)
*Wow so miau. Much cute.[^:fig:pic-source]*
Videos should be packed into a responsive

<Box ratio="16:9">

<iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/169809377" frameborder="0"></iframe>

</Box>

<Grid>

![Cat](./img/header.jpg)
*Hello Cat[^:fig:pic-source]*

</Grid>

<Grid background>

![Cat](./img/header.jpg)
*Hello Cat[^:fig:pic-source]*

</Grid>

<Grid>
<Column start="1" end="7">

### Cat Column A
...

</Column>
<Column start="7" end="13">

### Cat Column B
...

</Column>
</Grid>

<!--
Vorname Nachname, [Titel der Seite](https://www.google.com/) (Abrufdatum: dd. mm. yyyy).
Vorname Nachname, Buchtitel, Auflage, Verlag, Erscheinungsort Jahr, erste Seite – letzte Seite.
-->

# gets repalced with footnotes
group-include: fig

inline-link-prefix: 'Fig. '

reference-link-prefix: '↑ Fig. '
reference-link-suffix: ''

reference-text-suffix: ' – '
